traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Lead-in failure', 'path': ['SCREENING', 'LEAD_IN', 'EARLY_TERMINATION']}, {'condition': 'Elevated liver function tests', 'path': ['HEPATIC_ADJUDICATION', 'DISCONTINUATION']}, {'condition': 'Rescreening allowed if no criteria failed but randomization window missed', 'path': ['RESCREENING', 'LEAD_IN', 'RANDOMIZATION']}]

executionTypes.rationale: WINDOW signals: 3; EPISODE signals: 2; SINGLE signals: 2; RECURRING signals: 2
The protocol specifies CGM visits spanning weeks 10/11 and 22/23, requiring subjects to record sensor insertion times and collect data over these multi-day periods.
The protocol describes a conditional workflow where if insulin is reduced, attempts must be made to titrate back to baseline, with specific decision points regarding reductions >20%.
This is a conditional workflow triggered by elevated ketones; investigators must advise extra insulin/carbohydrates and consider reeducation based on the subject's status.
Site staff are required to review results recorded in the subject diary at each scheduled study visit.
The protocol specifies a specific screening assessment for HbA1c at the Week -1 Visit to determine eligibility (<=10.5%).
The amendment allows for optional phone visits to be conducted at specific scheduled intervals (Week -4, Week 2, and CGM weeks).

footnoteConditions.text: c. Optional Phone Visit - Week -4 visit can be done as a phone visit to allow flexibility for the subject in visit scheduling. If a phone visit is done, the home pregnancy kit and new week -4 visit diary should be given to the subject at the week -8 visit as well as additional glucose and ketone strips, if needed. Copies of completed diaries must be sent (scan, photo, fax) into the site prior to the phone visit so discussions can occur between the subject and site personnel about the data captured in the diaries.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Change from baseline in HbA1c
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant reduction compared to placebo plus adjustable insulin
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary objective of this study is to compare the change from baseline in HbA1c after 24 weeks of double-blinded treatment with dapagliflozin 5 mg or 10 mg plus adjustable insulin versus placebo p

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Percent change from baseline in total daily insulin dose
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Comparison of percent change between treatment groups
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Compare the percent change from baseline in total daily insulin dose with dapagliflozin 5 mg or 10 mg plus adjustable insulin versus placebo plus adjustable insulin after 24 weeks of double-blinded tr

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Percent change from baseline in body weight
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Comparison of percent change between treatment groups
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Compare the percent change from baseline in body weight with dapagliflozin 5 mg or 10 mg plus adjustable insulin versus placebo plus adjustable insulin after 24 weeks of double-blinded treatment

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Percent of CGM readings in target range
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Comparison of change from baseline in percentage between groups
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Compare the change from baseline in the percent of 24-hour glucose readings obtained from CGM that falls within the target range of >70 mg/dL and <=180 mg/dL

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Proportion of subjects achieving HbA1c reduction without severe hypoglycemia
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Higher proportion of subjects meeting criteria in treatment vs placebo
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: proportion of subjects achieving an HbA1c reduction from baseline to Week 24 visit >=0.5% without severe hypoglycemia events

endpointAlgorithms.name: Exploratory: Non-severe hypoglycemia events in HbA1c responders
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Comparison of event frequency per subject between groups in the responder subset
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: compare the number of non-severe hypoglycemic events per subject in those achieving a HbA1c reduction of >0.5% on dapagliflozin 5 mg or 10 mg plus adjustable insulin versus placebo plus adjustable ins

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in HbA1c
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Value prior to the start of double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Percent change from baseline in total daily insulin dose
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Value prior to the start of double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Percent change from baseline in body weight
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Value prior to the start of double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in mean value of 24-hour CGM glucose readings
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Mean value obtained from CGM prior to double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in mean amplitude of glucose excursion (MAGE)
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: MAGE calculated from CGM readings prior to double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in percent of 24-hour CGM readings within target range
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Week 24 percent in range - Baseline percent in range (Target: >70 and <=180 mg/dL)
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Percent of readings in target range prior to double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of subjects achieving HbA1c reduction >=0.5% without severe hypoglycemia
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Count of subjects with (HbA1c change <= -0.5% AND zero severe hypoglycemia events) / Total subjects
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: HbA1c value prior to double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of subjects with HbA1c < 7.0%
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Count of subjects with HbA1c < 7.0% at Week 24 / Total subjects

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in fasting plasma glucose (FPG)
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Value prior to the start of double-blind treatment

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in seated systolic blood pressure (hypertensive subgroup)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Week 24 SBP - Baseline SBP for subjects with Baseline SBP >=140 or DBP >=90
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Value prior to the start of double-blind treatment
